oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Negro Educator to Discuss Negro Youth Here

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Small broadside advertising a speech entitled "Negro Youth and His Problems" by Professor Merl R. Eppse.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Handbills; Posters; Public speaking; Youth
Nashville (Tenn.); Eppse, Merl R. (Merl Raymond), b. 1893; Tennessee State University; African American educators; African American -- Social life and customs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Merl Rawls Eppse was born in 1893 in Greenville, Ohio. He attended Wilberforce University, Ohio State University and Drake University. He received his Master's Degree from Columbia University. From 1928 through 1960 he was professor and later chairman of the Department of History at Tennessee Agricultural and Industrial College (later Tennessee State University). He died in Los Angeles, California, December 27, 1967.
